title: Exodus Chapter 38 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Exodus chapter 38 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Exodus Chapter 38 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Exodus Chapter 38.

questions.question: What was the altar of burnt offering made from according to Exodus 38:1?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:1 states the altar was made of shittim wood.

questions.question: How high was the altar of burnt offering as described in Exodus 38:1?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:1 specifies the altar's height as three cubits.

questions.question: What material was used to overlay the altar and its horns according to Exodus 38:2?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:2 states that the altar and its horns were overlaid with brass.

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT mentioned as a vessel made of brass for the altar in Exodus 38:3?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:3 lists pots, shovels, basins, fleshhooks, and firepans, but not candlesticks.

questions.question: What was the material used for the laver and its foot in Exodus 38:8?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:8 says the laver and its foot were made of brass.

questions.question: From where were the looking glasses used to make the laver obtained according to Exodus 38:8?
options: From the women assembling at the tabernacle door
questions.correctAnswer: From the women assembling at the tabernacle door
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:8 explains the looking glasses came from the women assembling at the door of the tabernacle.

questions.question: How many pillars were there on the south side of the court according to Exodus 38:10?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:10 states there were twenty pillars on the south side.

questions.question: What were the hooks of the pillars made of on the north side of the court according to Exodus 38:11?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:11 says the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.

questions.question: The hangings of the court were made of what material as described in Exodus 38:16?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:16 states all the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.

questions.question: What was the hanging for the gate of the court made of according to Exodus 38:18?
options: Needlework of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen
questions.correctAnswer: Needlework of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:18 describes the gate hangings as needlework of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 38:20, all the pins of the tabernacle and court were made of brass.
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:20 clearly states that all the pins of the tabernacle and of the court round about were of brass.

questions.question: True or False: Bezaleel was from the tribe of Dan according to Exodus 38:22.
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:22 says Bezaleel was of the tribe of Judah, not Dan.

questions.question: True or False: Aholiab was skilled in embroidery in blue, purple, and scarlet according to Exodus 38:23.
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:23 states that Aholiab was an engraver, cunning workman, and embroiderer in blue, purple, scarlet, and fine linen.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Exodus 38:26: 'A bekah for every man, that is, ______ a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary.'
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:26 specifies that a bekah is half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary.

questions.question: According to Exodus 38:24, how much gold was used for all the work of the holy place and the offering?
options: Twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:24 reports the gold used was twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels.

medium.title: Exodus Chapter 38 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Exodus Chapter 38 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with maintaining integrity in their work. Based on Exodus 38:22-23, what biblical truth would you share about work ethic?
options: God values skilled and diligent work done with faithfulness
Only leaders need to work hard; others should rest
Work is unimportant compared to prayer
God rewards only large projects, not small efforts
questions.correctAnswer: God values skilled and diligent work done with faithfulness
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:22-23 shows Bezaleel and Aholiab were gifted craftsmen who worked skillfully and faithfully on God's command, demonstrating the value God places on integrity and excellence in work. This teaches believers to serve with diligence and honesty.

questions.question: How does the detailed construction of the altar and court in Exodus 38 teach about obedience to God's Word?
options: Obedience involves careful attention to God's instructions
God accepts any way we want to do things
Physical details are not important in spiritual matters
Only the leaders need to obey carefully
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience involves careful attention to God's instructions
questions.explanation: Verses 1-31 describe how every measurement and material of the altar and court was done exactly as God commanded Moses, showing that true obedience involves careful, humble adherence to God's Word.

questions.question: A Christian is seeking to practice generosity and stewardship. What does Exodus 38:24-26 teach about giving?
options: Giving should be according to God’s instructions and counted carefully
Giving is optional and does not need to be measured
Only the wealthy are called to give
Giving should be secret and without accountability
questions.correctAnswer: Giving should be according to God’s instructions and counted carefully
questions.explanation: The passage details the precise amounts of gold and silver given and used for the tabernacle, emphasizing that generosity includes faithful, orderly giving in response to God’s commands.

questions.question: What lesson about humility and contentment can be drawn from the use of materials described in Exodus 38:8?
options: Even ordinary offerings, like the women’s mirrors, are valuable to God
God does not care about small or humble offerings
Wealth is necessary to serve God
questions.correctAnswer: Even ordinary offerings, like the women’s mirrors, are valuable to God
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:8 shows the laver was made from women’s mirrors, ordinary items given willingly, teaching that God values humble, willing offerings from all, encouraging contentment and gratitude.

questions.question: How does the structure of the tabernacle’s court, with its pillars and hangings (Exodus 38:9-20), illustrate the importance of order and fellowship in the church?
options: Orderly arrangement supports unity and reverence among God’s people
Physical order is irrelevant for spiritual fellowship
Fellowship happens best without rules or structure
Only leaders need to maintain order
questions.correctAnswer: Orderly arrangement supports unity and reverence among God’s people
questions.explanation: The carefully ordered pillars, sockets, and hangings demonstrate how God values order and structure that promote unity and reverence in His assembly, a principle for church life and fellowship.

questions.question: A believer faces temptation to shortcut their responsibilities at work. Based on Exodus 38:1-7, what biblical truth about perseverance and integrity can you share?
options: God calls us to build carefully and persevere with integrity in our tasks
It is acceptable to do half the work if in a hurry
Shortcutting is wise if it saves time
Only the appearance of work matters to God
questions.correctAnswer: God calls us to build carefully and persevere with integrity in our tasks
questions.explanation: The altar was made exactly as commanded, with detailed construction and materials, teaching believers the importance of perseverance and integrity in every responsibility.

questions.question: True or False: The pins used in the tabernacle and court were made of silver according to Exodus 38.
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:20 states that all the pins of the tabernacle and court round about were of brass, not silver.

questions.question: True or False: The detailed measurements of the tabernacle court’s hangings and pillars teach the value of discipline and order in worship.
questions.explanation: The precise measurements and materials for the tabernacle court (Exodus 38:9-19) show God values discipline, order, and reverence in worship, teaching believers to approach God with respect and structure.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Exodus 38:26 states a __________ was given by every man from twenty years old and upward for the tabernacle service.
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:26 specifies a bekah, which is half a shekel, was given by every man from twenty years old and upward, emphasizing faithful, equal contribution for God’s service.

questions.question: How can Exodus 38:21 encourage believers struggling with humility in service within the church?
options: Every role, counted and appointed by God, is vital for His work
Only visible roles matter in church service
Service is optional for most believers
questions.correctAnswer: Every role, counted and appointed by God, is vital for His work
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:21 highlights the service of the Levites by the hand of Ithamar, showing that God values each appointed role and teaches humility in serving faithfully wherever called.

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged by the complexity of serving God. How does Exodus 38:29-31 provide encouragement about perseverance?
options: God honors faithful completion of all tasks, big or small
Complex tasks are only for professionals
God prefers simple, quick service over thorough work
Only spiritual gifts matter, not effort
questions.correctAnswer: God honors faithful completion of all tasks, big or small
questions.explanation: These verses show how all parts of the tabernacle, including sockets and pins, were made faithfully, encouraging perseverance and care in all service to God.

questions.question: How does Exodus 38:17-19 teach believers about being grateful and content with God’s provision?
options: God’s provision, even for details like silver overlays, is sufficient and beautiful
We must always want more than what God provides
Gratitude is unrelated to God’s material blessings
questions.correctAnswer: God’s provision, even for details like silver overlays, is sufficient and beautiful
questions.explanation: The careful use of silver for hooks, fillets, and chapiters shows God’s provision covers every detail, teaching believers to appreciate and be content with what God provides.

questions.question: In facing trials of faithfulness, what does Exodus 38:4-7 teach about spiritual discipline and perseverance?
options: God desires consistent, detailed effort to uphold His work
Spiritual discipline is only for leaders
Perseverance is optional in God’s service
God rewards only spontaneous acts, not steady work
questions.correctAnswer: God desires consistent, detailed effort to uphold His work
questions.explanation: The making of the brasen grate, rings, and staves with precision shows God values steady, disciplined labor in spiritual service, encouraging perseverance.

questions.question: How does the involvement of multiple tribes and craftsmen in Exodus 38:22-23 teach about unity and serving others in the church?
options: Each person’s unique gifts contribute to God’s work
Only one tribe or group should serve
Service is a competition, not cooperation
Individual work is more important than teamwork
questions.correctAnswer: Each person’s unique gifts contribute to God’s work
questions.explanation: Bezaleel from Judah and Aholiab from Dan worked together using their different skills, showing how unity and using diverse gifts are essential for serving God’s purposes.

questions.question: What biblical principle about forgiveness and reconciliation can be connected to the careful construction and covering of the altar’s horns in Exodus 38:2?
options: God’s altar symbolizes a place where sins are covered and forgiveness is offered
Punishment is the only response to sin
Forgiveness is unnecessary if works are done
questions.correctAnswer: God’s altar symbolizes a place where sins are covered and forgiveness is offered
questions.explanation: The horns overlaid with brass on the altar (Exodus 38:2) represent the covering and power of sacrifice, teaching believers the importance of forgiveness and reconciliation through God’s provision.

hard.title: Exodus Chapter 38 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Exodus Chapter 38.

questions.question: What material was used to overlay the altar of burnt offering, as described in Exodus 38?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:2 states that the altar was overlaid with brass, which was a common metal symbolizing judgment and purification in the tabernacle context.

questions.question: The altar of burnt offering was made of which type of wood, significant for its durability and symbolic meaning?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:1 mentions shittim wood, which is acacia wood, known for its hardness and resistance, symbolizing endurance and purity in the tabernacle construction.

questions.question: How many cubits in length and breadth was the altar of burnt offering?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:1 describes the altar as five cubits in length and breadth, making it a perfect square, which symbolizes completeness and perfection.

questions.question: What was the height of the altar of burnt offering?
questions.explanation: The altar’s height is given as three cubits in Exodus 38:1, a dimension that aligns with the altar’s functional design and symbolic meaning in ritual.

questions.question: What was the function of the four rings cast for the altar's grate as described in Exodus 38?
options: To hold the staves for carrying
To secure the altar to the ground
questions.correctAnswer: To hold the staves for carrying
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:5 explains that the four rings were for the four ends of the grate to place the staves in, allowing the altar to be carried during transport, reflecting the nomadic nature of Israel’s worship.

questions.question: The laver was made from what source of metal, showcasing communal contribution?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:8 states the laver was made from the looking-glasses of the women who assembled at the tabernacle, symbolizing communal involvement in the sanctuary’s construction.

questions.question: What color materials were used in the needlework of the gate’s hanging of the court?
options: Blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen
questions.correctAnswer: Blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:18 describes the gate’s hanging as needlework of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, colors symbolizing royalty, priesthood, and holiness.

questions.question: How many pillars were on the south side of the court, and what material were their sockets made of?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:9-10 specifies the south side had twenty pillars with brass sockets, emphasizing the use of durable metals for structural support in the tabernacle courtyard.

questions.question: The total silver collected from the congregation, as recorded in Exodus 38, was used primarily for what purpose?
options: Casting sockets of the sanctuary and veil
Crafting vessels of the holy place
questions.correctAnswer: Casting sockets of the sanctuary and veil
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:25-27 explains that the hundred talents of silver were used to cast the sockets of the sanctuary and the veil, illustrating the dedicated use of the congregation's offerings.

questions.question: Who was the chief craftsman responsible for making all that the LORD commanded Moses in this chapter?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:22 identifies Bezaleel, son of Uri, as the chief craftsman who made all the items commanded by the LORD to Moses, highlighting his divinely inspired skill.

questions.question: Aholiab, mentioned alongside Bezaleel, was skilled in what specific crafts?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:23 describes Aholiab as an engraver and cunning workman, skilled especially in embroidery with blue, purple, scarlet, and fine linen, reflecting the artistry required.

questions.question: According to Exodus 38, what was the amount of gold used for the work in the holy place?
options: Twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels
Seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:24 records the gold used as twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels, showing the significant investment in precious metals for the sanctuary.

questions.question: The brass used for the altar and related items weighed how many talents and shekels?
options: Seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels
Fifty talents and one thousand shekels
Twenty-nine talents and seven hundred shekels
questions.correctAnswer: Seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:29 states the brass offering totaled seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels, indicating the large quantity of this metal used for the altar and vessels.

questions.question: True or False: All the pins of the tabernacle and the court round about were made of silver.
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:20 and 38:31 clarify that all the pins of the tabernacle and the court were made of brass, not silver, highlighting the use of brass for structural elements.

questions.question: The census of men from twenty years old and upward who gave the half-shekel offering numbered how many?
options: Six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred fifty
questions.correctAnswer: Six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred fifty
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:26 records the number of men counted as six hundred thousand, three thousand, and five hundred fifty, showing the scale of the congregation's participation.

theological.title: Exodus Chapter 38 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Exodus Chapter 38 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What material was used to overlay the altar of burnt offering described in Exodus 38?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:2 states the altar was overlaid with brass, symbolizing judgment and purification in biblical typology (See also Leviticus 16:27, 2 Chronicles 4:2, Hebrews 9:4, Revelation 1:15).

questions.question: According to Exodus 38, what was the length and breadth of the altar of burnt offering?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:1 describes the altar as being five cubits in length and breadth, indicating the altar's perfect square shape, representing divine completeness (See also Exodus 27:1, Ezekiel 43:15, Revelation 21:16, Hebrews 13:10).

questions.question: Who was responsible for making all that the LORD commanded Moses according to Exodus 38?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:22 identifies Bezaleel as the chief craftsman appointed by God, showing divine empowerment for sacred work (See Exodus 31:1-6, 1 Chronicles 2:20, 2 Timothy 1:6, Romans 12:6).

questions.question: What was made from the looking-glasses of the women assembling at the tabernacle door?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:8 shows the laver of brass made from the women's mirrors, symbolizing communal participation in worship and purification (See also Exodus 30:17-21, 2 Chronicles 4:6, John 13:10, Hebrews 10:22).

questions.question: What was the covering material for the hangings of the court all around?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:16 declares the hangings were made of fine twined linen, reflecting purity and holiness (See also Exodus 26:1, Revelation 19:8, Leviticus 16:4, Hebrews 9:19).

questions.question: The hooks of the pillars and their fillets in the tabernacle court were made of what material?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:10-11 and 17 indicate the hooks and fillets were of silver, symbolizing redemption and purity (See also Exodus 30:11-16, Psalm 66:15, 1 Peter 1:18-19, Revelation 5:9).

questions.question: How many pillars were there on the south side of the court?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:9-10 states there were twenty pillars on the south side, indicating the order and structure God ordained for worship (See also Exodus 27:9-11, 1 Kings 7:15, Hebrews 9:2, Revelation 21:12).

questions.question: What was the height in breadth of the court gate’s hanging described in Exodus 38?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:18 specifies the gate’s hanging height as five cubits, matching the court hangings, symbolizing access to God's presence (See also Exodus 27:16, Psalm 24:7-10, John 10:9, Hebrews 10:19-22).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The staves for the altar were made of ____, and overlaid with brass.
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:6 states the staves were made of shittim wood, a durable wood symbolizing incorruptibility, used also in the Ark (See also Exodus 25:10, Numbers 7:3, Hebrews 9:4, Revelation 11:19).

questions.question: According to Exodus 38, the silver for the tabernacle was collected as a half-shekel from whom?
options: Every man from twenty years old and upward
questions.correctAnswer: Every man from twenty years old and upward
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:26 states the half-shekel was collected from every man aged twenty and older, reflecting the principle of communal responsibility for worship (See also Exodus 30:12, Numbers 1:3, 2 Corinthians 8:12, Hebrews 7:5).

questions.question: How many talents of gold were used in all the work of the holy place according to Exodus 38?
options: Twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels
questions.correctAnswer: Twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:24 quantifies the gold used, emphasizing the costly devotion required for God's dwelling (See also 1 Kings 6:22, 2 Chronicles 3:8, Matthew 6:21, Revelation 21:18).

questions.question: What was made from the hundred talents of silver mentioned in Exodus 38?
options: The sockets of the sanctuary and the veil
questions.correctAnswer: The sockets of the sanctuary and the veil
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:27 explains the silver was used for sockets, illustrating the foundation and support of the sanctuary's holiness (See also Exodus 26:11, 1 Kings 7:50, Hebrews 9:2, Revelation 21:14).

questions.question: What role did Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, have in the making of the tabernacle?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:23 describes Aholiab as an engraver and embroiderer skilled in blue, purple, scarlet, and fine linen, emphasizing the beauty and sacredness of worship (See also Exodus 31:6, 1 Chronicles 4:15, Psalm 78:72, Ephesians 2:10).

questions.question: The altar described in Exodus 38 was made hollow with what?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:7 states the altar was made hollow with boards, indicating the altar’s functional design for sacrifice and typology of Christ's body as a sacrificial vessel (See also Exodus 25:10, Hebrews 10:5-10, John 1:29, Romans 6:10).

questions.question: What were all the pins of the tabernacle and of the court round about made of?
questions.explanation: Exodus 38:20 and 38:31 mention all the pins were made of brass, symbolizing strength and judgment, consistent with the altar's brass overlay (See also Numbers 21:9, 2 Chronicles 4:2, John 3:14, Revelation 1:15).
